Parvocellular oculomotor nucleus.EditorialNote: Neuronames has the parvocellular oculomotor nucleus as the preferred label but I think Edinger Westphal is more common.
Parvocellular oculomotor nucleus.Definition: Nucleus that is part of the oculomotor nerve complex consisting of preganglionic parasympathetic neurons situated close to the midline at the level of the superior colliculus (Heimer, the Human Brain and Spinal Cord, 1994, pg 244)
